holidays.name: National Creamsicle Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the delightful frozen treat that combines creamy vanilla and tangy orange flavors in a refreshing popsicle form.
holidays.origin: The Creamsicle was invented in the early 1900s, with the treat becoming popular in the 1950s as an ideal summer frozen dessert.
holidays.funFact: The Creamsicle actually came before the more famous Fudgsicle, making it one of the first branded ice pops in America!

holidays.name: Violet Warning Day
holidays.description: A quirky day that humorously warns people about the surprising invasiveness of violet flowers in gardens.
holidays.origin: Originated from gardening communities noticing how these seemingly innocent flowers spread rapidly and take over beds and lawns.
holidays.funFact: Though delicate-looking, violets can spread underground by runners, making them tough to remove once established.

holidays.name: National Black Cow Day
holidays.description: A celebration of the tasty classic soda fountain drink made with root beer and creamy vanilla ice cream.
holidays.origin: Black Cow is a vintage soda fountain favorite dating back to the early 20th century, often enjoyed as a retro indulgence.
holidays.funFact: Different regions have variations of the Black Cow; in some places, it's called a Root Beer Float.

holidays.name: National Financial Awareness Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about the importance of financial literacy and awareness of personal finances.
holidays.origin: Created by financial education advocates to encourage better money management and understanding of finances.
holidays.funFact: Research shows many Americans struggle with basic money management skills‚Äîthis day aims to help change that!
